intro: Haplopappus pucidulus, commonly known as the narrowleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its small, yellowish flowers are surrounded by narrow, leaf-like bracts. Haplopappus pucidulus is often found in arid regions and is adapted to thrive in low-nutrient environments.
